column4: Where does natty store the UUID for the swap partition needed for hibernation resume?
sudo blkid     will show it, if that's what you mean
that isn't what I mean. I mean Ubuntu stores the location of the swap partition under /etc somewhere so it knows to look there upon resume.
the config file this article references does not exist in natty. http://sites.google.com/site/lightrush/random-1/howtofixhibernateafterresizingswappartitiononubuntu
